newsitem.title: UK: US stocks mixed in London, Philip Morris up.
newsitem.headline: US stocks mixed in London, Philip Morris up.

text.p: U.S. stocks were mixed in London on Friday, and dealers said they expected Wall Street to open steady to lower after Thursday's slide.
In otherwise quiet dealings, shares in Philip Morris advanced to $136-3/4 in London, up $1-1/4 from their close in New York, where they gained $2.
News that a federal judge dismissed a lawsuit filed by 11 counties in California against the tobacco industry fuelled the advance, dealers said.
"There may be a knock on effect in other states," said one dealer.
Shares in RJR Nabisco added $1/2 to $37-1/4.
Elsewhere, technology shares, which led the U.S. equity market lower on the Thursday, were mostly firmer, but dealers noted little interest in the sector.
"No one is jumping forward," said another dealer. "A lot of people are just stepping back. Intel closing below $140 yesterday really scared people off."
Shares in Intel Corp were marked up $3/8 to $140 in London, after plummeting $6-41/64 in New York.
Shares in Motorola Corp were up $3/8 to $56, while shares in Microsoft Corp nudged up $1/8 to $96-1/4. But shares in International Business Machines Corp slipped $1/4 to $143-1/8.
Oil prices remained under pressure, weighed on shares in oil companies, dealers said.
Mobil Corp and Atlantic Richfield Co each eased $3/8 to $$123-3/4 and $126-3/8, respectively. Shares in Texaco Inc fell $1/4 to $100.
